#summary How to test Ex11.c in Hypre

= Step 1 =

Copy ex11.c to directory ../src/test

= Step 2 =
 
To ../src/test/Makefile add/change the following lines.  This follows the logic for example 5.
Note: remember to use tabs in 2nd 2 lines of ex11: ...

{{{
HYPRE_F77_EXAMPLES_DRIVERS =\
 ex1_for.c\
 ex3_for.c\
 ex5_for.c\
 ex6_for.c\
 ex7_for.c\
 ex11.c
...............
        rm -f ex1 ex2 ex3 ex4 ex5 ex5b ex5b77 ex6 ex7 ex8 ex9 ex11
...............
ex11: fij_mv.o fparcsr_mv.o fparcsr_ls.o ex11.o
        @echo "Building" $@ "... "
        ${LINK_CC} -o $@ fij_mv.o fparcsr_mv.o fparcsr_ls.o $@.o ${FFLAGS} ${LFLAGS}
}}}
 
= Step 3 =
 
compile and linkedit ex11.c to create ex11.o and ex11
{{{
>make ex11
}}}
 
= Step 4 =
 
execute ex11
{{{
>mpirun -np 4 ./ex11
}}}
or just
{{{
>./ex11
}}}
